subject: Returns
description_text:
Hello,

I have some products that were broken and I need to return them. I have
been communicating with a Simsonn rep for about 2 months now and have been
completely ghosted. I am incredibly frustrated that I have two products
that I cannot use and I just want to return them. I'm sorry if this is
frustrating for your team, but I am out a significant amount of money for
two products that don't function properly. If you can't see my other email
chain then I am happy to cc you into it.

Weston Fredrickson

conversations.body_text: Hi Weston Fredrickson,    Okay, thank you for your confirmation. We have already arranged for FedEx to ship your order, which is expected to arrive around the 16th.

Hi Weston Fredrickson,  It is very unlikely that both devices would fail at the same time; the issue is most likely related to USB power. Please make sure to connect the USB cable directly to the rear USB 3.0 (blue) port of your computer. Do not use a regular USB hub — if you must use one, please ensure it is a powered hub with independent supply. Additionally, please provide photos of your pedal and sequential shifter installation. If the software recognizes the devices but no input is detected, this could be a driver issue. Have you tried testing on another computer? You can also check using the VKB JoyTester tool. If you need to send a video, please ensure the file is fully uploaded before sending; otherwise, I won’t be able to open incomplete attachments.

I'll attach a video to the end of this email.

I have just tried using another PC and will get to VKB JoyTester when I get
some more time. I have the same exact issue with the other computer. I
downloaded the Simsonn Product Manager from the website with the same
results unfortunately. As for the driver issue I uninstalled the Product
Manager (aside from the couple files that it didn't want to uninstall) and
re-installed the Product Manager which wiped the drivers and reinstalled
them. All of the cables are routed in a way which they are not pinched at
any point. I've attached two videos, if they do not work please let me know
and I will reupload them. Thanks for your time and help.
 IMG_6412.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TrDhyOG0n3lzjP1y_OILAVjHnqx3lvK4/view?usp=drive_web>

Hi Weston Fredrickson,    I’ve just reviewed your VKB screenshots. Please try updating the firmware separately as follows:    Pedals: Go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware → pedals → plusx.sfu to update the pedal firmware.    Sequential Shifter: Go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → seq-firmware → gear → sqpro.sfu to update the sequential shifter firmware.    If the issue still persists after updating, I will resend you the plusx.sfu and sqpro.sfu firmware files. Rest assured, this problem can definitely be resolved, and I will follow up with you promptly.

work I would really like to return both products. It looks like we have a
timezone difference which is okay. I should be at my PC tomorrow night
which I believe is your working hours. Thank you so much for all of the
help.

Hi Weston Fredrickson,     You only need to update the pedal firmware to restore it.  Please try to recover the PlusX pedals: press and hold the recovery button on the controller, then reconnect the USB. SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0 should automatically enter recovery mode.  Then go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update, and select the pedals-firmware-pedals-plusx.sfu file to update.  After the update is complete, check the connection status.  If it still doesn’t work, please connect the USB cable to a USB 3.0 port on the back of your PC. Avoid using a USB hub without external power, as unstable power supply may cause disconnections.

Hi Weston Fredrickson,    At the front bottom of the handbrake (indicated by the arrow), there is a small rectangular hole that contains the recovery button. Please use a toothpick to gently push it to the other side, then reconnect the USB cable. The device will enter recovery mode.  Next, go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → handbrake-firmware → handbrake-hbpro.sfu in the software, and complete the update.  After the upgrade, make sure to switch the recovery button back to its original position. You may also use the VKB tool to check the device connection status.
